list-item.p: Are there examples of ENSDs where there is direct evidence for the presence or absence of O 2?
Why are ENSDs assumed to be sourced from sulfate rather than reduced sulfur species that formed during the deposition and early diagenesis of the original evaporite deposits?
Why is an oxidant for sulfide required if the ultimate sulfur source is sulfate, the most oxidized form of sulfur?
Why is O 2 considered the prime driver for sulfide oxidation in the canonical model?
How could O 2 be problematic for the formation of native sulfur if it is considered a prerequisite?
Is there geochemical evidence from the rock record that indicates a lack of O 2 supply to sites where epigenetic native sulfur formation took place?
